lexUnit.name: top.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: situated in the highest position or at the highest point or part of an object.

sentence.text: These fish exclusively inhabit the very top layer of the aquarium , they will take the usual food but it is important they receive some freeze-dried or frozen tubifex or bloodworm .
It had a nasty , disfiguring stain running along the whole of the top edge .
Turn the 4cm ( 1 Â½in ) heading allowance to the wrong side along the tacked line indicating the top edge of the curtains .
It is important that the top edge of the pool be levelled as , on filling the pool , the water level will immediately show any non-levelness in the edging surface .
The top floors of the building were converted into an hotel owned by Cook and run by his wife Marianne .
In her small workroom on the top floor of a crumbling old warehouse in Whitechapel Theresa Arnold shivered and turned on another bar of her portable gas fire .
Leaving the bathroom , the immediate lobby on the south side of the top floor is fitted with a pair of walnut wall cabinets .
The bookcase was the top half of a big old-fashioned dresser .
There was only one door in the hallway , this made up of two sections so that the top half could be swung back on its own .
The top half of the stable door was open but Waldegrave had apparently closed the bottom behind him .
Rahmi was plainly in awe of Boris , and fidgeted anxiously , fastening and unfastening the top button of his pink polo shirt while the Russian called room service .
He glanced at his watch , opened the top drawer of his desk and swept the papers in .
He shook out the handkerchief and stuffed it back in the top pocket of his jacket .
Jack finished his tea and put some cigarettes from his pack into his top pocket .
There were a couple of ballpoint pens clipped to the top left-hand pocket of his white coat .
I stare , in morbid fascination , at the squashed fly which is adhered to the top right hand corner of the screen .
He pulled out a folder from the top shelf .
